# start()

**Instance Method**

Starts searching the index for items that match the current query string and parameters.

## Declaration

```swift
func start()
```

## Discussion

This method uses the configured search parameters and query string to begin a search of the index. It then delivers the results of that search to the closures in the [doc://com.apple.corespotlight/documentation/CoreSpotlight/CSSearchQuery/foundItemsHandler], [doc://com.apple.corespotlight/documentation/CoreSpotlight/CSUserQuery/foundSuggestionsHandler], and [doc://com.apple.corespotlight/documentation/CoreSpotlight/CSSearchQuery/completionHandler] properties of the query object.



## Executing the query with handler blocks

- **cancel()**: Cancels the current query operation.
- **foundSuggestionsHandler**: The block to execute when the query delivers a new batch of suggested items.
- **foundSuggestionCount**: The number of suggested items the query found so far.
